#include <stdio.h>
#define MAX 100
#define MAXVALUE 200

unsigned can[MAX * MAXVALUE];
const unsigned m[MAX] = {3,2,3,2,2,77,89,23,90,11};
const unsigned n = 10;

void solve(void)
{ unsigned long p, i, j;
  for (p = i = 0; i < n; p += m[i++]);
  for (i = 0; i <= p; i++) can[i] = 0;
  can[0] = 1;
  
  for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
     for (j = p; j + 1 > 0; j--)
        if (can[j] > 0 && can[j + m[i]] == 0) 
              can[j + m[i]] = i + 1; 
  
  for (i = p/2; i > 1; i--)  
     if (can[i] > 0) 
  { printf("%u : %u\n", i, p-i);
    while (i > 0) 
    { printf("%u, ", m[can[i] - 1]);
      i = i - m[can[i] - 1];                
    }    
    return;
  }    
}

int main()
{ solve();
  int k; scanf("%u", &k);
  return 0;  
}
